parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 1st Person Plural
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be ashamed, be ashamed of. From epi and aischunomai; to feel shame for something.
This; he, she, it.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
